meanings.definition: (adjective) Having the characteristics or qualities of an intellectual or academic person.
meanings.sent1: The eggheaded professor always had a book in hand.
meanings.sent2: She admired his eggheaded approach to problem-solving.
meanings.sent3: The eggheaded student even brought a dictionary to the party.
meanings.sent4: His eggheaded nature shone brightly during the debate.
meanings.sent5: The eggheaded scientist's glasses reflected the light of knowledge.

meanings.definition: (noun) A person who is considered to be overly intellectual or academic in their pursuits.
meanings.sent1: The group of eggheads discussed complex theories late into the night.
meanings.sent2: She found it hard to relate to the egghead in her class.
meanings.sent3: The egghead's idea of fun was reading research papers.
meanings.sent4: He was known as the egghead of the family, always buried in books.
meanings.sent5: The young egghead's passion for learning was contagious.
